class_notes: GH SRP MPH students through March 23. GEH, GH, and GLEPI begins 6:00am March 24th and goes through through March 27.  All other MPH/MSPH students may enroll on March 28.
course_description: This course covers the effectiveness, benefits, WHO/CDC/ACOG guidelines for contraceptive methods and recent efforts to improve use of effective contraception in the United States. Includes historical and ethical perspectives on contraception policies, laws, and accessibility throughout the world and their impact on fertility. Includes information on long acting reversible contraception (LARC), user dependent methods, abortion, withdrawal, and male and female condoms.
